College, 1920 Princeton University, 1922 Boston Bulldogs, 1926
|CollegeHOF= |HOF= }} 'Charles Herbert "Herb" Treat' (December 16, 1900 â April
19, 1947) was an American football player who played for Princeton University
and was unanimously selected as an All-American at the tackle position in 1922.
He was also the player-coach of the first professional football team in Boston,
the Boston Bulldogs of 1926. In 1943, Treat was badly injured when he was struck
by an automobile, and he died four years later after falling nine stories from a
hotel in Kansas City, Missouri.
categories: Players of American football from Massachusetts
